text: Verbesina chapmanii, commonly known as Chapman's crownbeard, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae and the genus Verbesina. It is a perennial dicot. It is native to the Florida panhandle, growing in fire prone pine flatwoods. The plant has wingless stems and rough hairy leaves.http://www.fnai.org/FieldGuide/pdf/Verbesina_heterophylla.pdf It can grow up to tall and forms a cypsela fruit. The yellow flowers emerge in June to August. ==References== Category:Flora of the United States chapmanii
title: Verbesina chapmanii
